thread.title: La'Mar Winston, Oregon Ducks 4-star pledge, tweets recruiting pitch to USC Trojans commits
thread.title_full: La'Mar Winston, Oregon Ducks 4-star pledge, tweets recruiting pitch to USC Trojans commits | OregonLive.com

author: Andrew Nemec | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: La'Mar Winston, Oregon Ducks 4-star pledge, tweets recruiting pitch to USC Trojans commits
text:
In the wake of USC coach Steve Sarkisian's firing Monday, college football programs are sure to go after Trojans football class of 2016 commitments, as the future in Los Angeles has become uncertain.
Rivals five-star linebacker Daelin Hayes has already de-committed and the nation's No. 1 tight end, Isaac Nauta, has canceled his visit to USC .
Hoping to do his part to lure commits away from the Trojans, Oregon Ducks four-star athlete La'Mar Winston tweeted a short recruiting pitch to players currently committed to USC:
To all you USC commits, Oregon has a home for you, don't be shy.. Come join the familyüê•... We'd love to have youüéâ
‚Äî La'Marvelous‚õΩÔ∏è (@LamarWinstonJr) October 12, 2015
While the 6-foot-2, 210-pound future linebacker may be sending a message that is equal parts trolling and recruitment, it's clear USC will have to worry about programs poaching their commitments.
Prior to Sarkisian's announced leave of absence, and eventual firing, USC had the nation's No. 6 recruiting class, according to ESPN . In updated team rankings on 247Sports, the Trojans have already fallen three spots to No. 9 .
Oregon, for one, could stand to benefit from the turmoil surrounding the USC football program. And as Winston has made abundantly clear, it's officially game on.
-- Andrew Nemec
anemec@oregonian.com
@ AndrewNemec
